name: IntuneWin32App
description: A PowerShell module for managing the complete lifecycle of Win32 applications in Microsoft Intune. Features 40+ functions for packaging, publishing, detection rules, requirement rules, assignments, dependencies, and supersedence with support for x64, x86, and ARM64 architectures.
author: Nickolaj Andersen

securityCheck.aiSummary: Moderate security concerns: in-memory handling of access tokens (cred_theft), a generic executable launcher (malicious) that could be misused, and potential XML injection risk when finalizing Azure Storage blob uploads (exfiltration). No obfuscated code, no hardcoded secrets, and no remote code execution detected. The codebase appears to be a legitimate IntuneWin32App tooling library, but apply token minimization, input validation, and safe XML construction to mitigate the identified risks.
